data.title: Smart-seq2 for sensitive full-length transcriptome profiling in single cells.
data.abstract:
1. Nat Methods. 2013 Nov;10(11):1096-8. doi: 10.1038/nmeth.2639. Epub 2013 Sep
22.

Smart-seq2 for sensitive full-length transcriptome profiling in single cells.

Picelli S(1), Björklund ÅK, Faridani OR, Sagasser S, Winberg G, Sandberg R.

Author information:
(1)Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research, Stockholm, Sweden.

Single-cell gene expression analyses hold promise for characterizing cellular 
heterogeneity, but current methods compromise on either the coverage, the 
sensitivity or the throughput. Here, we introduce Smart-seq2 with improved 
reverse transcription, template switching and preamplification to increase both 
yield and length of cDNA libraries generated from individual cells. Smart-seq2 
transcriptome libraries have improved detection, coverage, bias and accuracy 
compared to Smart-seq libraries and are generated with off-the-shelf reagents at 
lower cost.

DOI: 10.1038/nmeth.2639
